definition: minute
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]
handleless cup/goblet/to concentrate/variant of 鐘|钟[zhong1]
surname Zhong
brief period of enthusiasm/flash in the pan
ten years of practice for one minute on the stage (idiom)
pinyin: tai2 shang4 yi1 fen1 zhong1 , tai2 xia4 shi2 nian2 gong1
containing_words.word: 台上一分钟，台下十年功

sentences.english: I ate a few minutes ago.
sentences.chinese: 吃了，我几分钟前吃了饭。

sentences.english: Blend oils and then add to a bowl of steaming water and inhale for five minutes.
sentences.chinese: 混合油，然后添加到一碗热气腾腾的水和吸入五分钟。

sentences.english: Cofie then had a goal disallowed on 35 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡35分钟时的一个进球又被剥夺。

sentences.english: Fenders will be ready in 20 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 防碰垫将在20分钟内准备好。

sentences.english: However, Massimo Ambronisi equalized in the 25th minute for Milan.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，安布罗西尼在25分钟为米兰扳平了比分。

sentences.english: Metro line 2 to century avenue Station, about 10 min walk to the hostel.
sentences.chinese: 坐地铁2号线世纪大道站下，步行10分钟到旅舍。

sentences.english: Please resume your seats, as the performance will continue in two minutes.
sentences.chinese: 请回到你们的座位上，表演两分钟后将继续进行。

sentences.english: The measuring rate is about 188 data per minute.
sentences.chinese: 测量速度约为每分钟188个数据。

sentences.english: Webcast of the take-off and landing will go live 5 minutes prior to each event.
sentences.chinese: 网上直播的起飞和降落会活5分钟前，每个事件。

sentences.english: First of all, it will only be a minute or two at a time, maybe once or twice a lecture.
sentences.chinese: 首先，每次只有一两分钟，一堂课最多不超过两次。

sentences.english: Use 2 to 3 minutes eash time, it can be used for around two weeks.
sentences.chinese: 用2至3分钟的时间锈，它可以用于两个星期左右。

sentences.english: Spain scored in the final minute of the game.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙队在比赛最后一分钟进了一球。

sentences.english: On average, Habbos users spend about 39 minutes per visit to the site.
sentences.chinese: 平均来说，哈宝用户每次花上39分钟来浏览网站。

sentences.english: Time is the most fair and reasonable-it never gives more to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 时间是最公平合理的，它从不多给谁一分钟。

sentences.english: Maximal oxygen uptake and minute ventilation did not change in either group.
sentences.chinese: 最大耗氧量和每分钟通气量，两组均未发生显著改变。

sentences.english: When the band only played for 15 minutes, the fans felt they had been shortchanged.
sentences.chinese: 乐队只演奏了15分钟，粉丝们觉得自己受骗了。

definition: midway/mediocre (quality)/midfield (soccer)
restricted area/forbidden region
second (unit of time)/arc second (angular measurement unit)/(coll.) instantly
corner kick (in soccer)/free strike in hockey
to lift a siege/to help sb out of trouble or embarrassment
to arrest/to capture/to seize/to win (a set, a game etc)
(sports) to extend the duration of a game (due to stoppages)/(abbr. for 傷停補時|伤停补时[shang1 ting2 bu3 shi2]) injury time
power shot (e.g. in soccer)
to knock on the door/to take a shot on goal (sports)
ball (made of rubber, leather etc)
to set up a teammate (with an opportunity to score)/to throw a game
to equalize/to level the score/to pull back the advantage
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
(math.) to inscribe/internally tangent
to pull back/to regain (one's dignity etc)/to recover from (an adverse situation)/to turn the tables
(sports) injury time
